175272-d-10-01-02-SOO.Narrative: ASSIGNMENT #G 46 WAS IN THE PROCESS OF PULLING TRACK C-34 FROM THE CLASS YARD TO WEST YARD ASSIGNMENT HAD PULLED APPROXIMATELY 30 CARS PAST THE NYO WHEN EMPLOYEE  NOTICED A LARGE AMOUNT OF DUST COMMING FROM THE REAR DRAG OF CARS BEING PULLED HE THEN HAD CONDUCTOR RADIO CREW PULLING OUT OF BOWL TO STOP MOVEMENT.   G46 CREW CAME TO A CONTROLLED STOP. FURTHER INSPECTION OF TRAIN FOUND THAT THE REAR CAR IN THE DRAG TR 601252 HAD DERAILED THE REAR WHEELS AND RERAILED SAME AFTER GOING OVER A FROG, THELAST TWO CARS IN THE DRAG SOO5535 MTY FLAT, AND MSDR 195251LUMBER HAD DERAILED.  SOO 5535 ALL WHEELS DERAILED CAR LANDED ON TOP OF 332 POWER SWITCH AND SWITCH HEATERS, MSDR 195251 A-END DERAILED ALLWHEELS.    P.O.D. APPROXIMATELTY 140 FEET EAST OF THE 332 SWITCH FIRST WHEEL OF THE SOO 5535 RODE ONTOP OF THE RAIL AT THE FIFTH DOWDY FALLING TO THE OUTSIDE OF THE RAIL ON THE SOUTH SIDE THE NORTH WHEEL DERAILED APPROXIMATELTY 10 FEET WEST OF THE ORIGNAL P.O.D.  FURTHER INVESTIGATION WILL TAKE PLACE ON WEDNESDAY AM , REVIEW OF SPEED TAPES AND ACTUAL FOOTAGE.  CARS WERE ON THE GROUND.   TRACK C-31 THRU C34 ARE OUT OF SERVICE.NoneNoneNone

FORMAL INVESTIGATION WAS HOLD ON 11/13/02, INVESTIGATION RESULTS FOUND TO BE INCONCLUSIVE THEREFORE, RESPONSIBLE EMPLOYEE(S) TO THE MISLINED SWITCH WAS UNDETERMINABLE.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

175747-d-10-25-02-SOO.Narrative: LAKE ENGINE ASSIGNMENT WAS MOVING EAST ON THE EB TO GET ONTO THEIR TRAIN. AS THEY WERE MOVING LITE ENGINE 4403 THEY RAN INTO THE SIDE OF THE 4TH AND 5TH REAR CARS OF TRAIN 654 WHICH WAS ON THE RUNNINGTRACK. INSPECTION OF THE AREA REVEALED THE XO SWITCH ON THE EASTBOUND SIDE OF THE XO SWITCH WAS LINED INTO THE RUNNING TRACK.  ENGINE WAS POINTED WEST AND WAS OPERATING LONG HOOD FORWARD AT THE TIMEOF THE COLLISION.  TARGET FOR THE XO SWITCH IN QUESTION IS IN BETWEEN THE EASTBOUND AND RUNNING TRACKS. CREW WAS PROCEEDING AND THE POSITION OF THE SWITCHES WAS NOT DISCUSSED PRIOR TO THE MOVEMENT OCCURRING.  CONDR WAS DISTRACTED GETTING THE TRACK BULLETINS AND LIST OUT FOR THE ENGR AND THE ENGR HADNO CLEAR COMMUINICATION AS TO ROUTE OR SWITCH POSITION BEFORE PROCEEDING.  LEFT REAR CORNER OF THELOCOMOTIVE STRUCK IN BETWEEN THE TWO RAILCARS IMCX 12510 AND GCCX 173641,  DAMAGING THE HAND HOLDS AND SAFETY APPLIANCES ON THE CORRESPONDING CORNERS OF THE HOPPER CARS AND NEITHER HOPPER IS LEAKING CONTENTS.  BOTH HOPPER CARS WERE PLACED ON MAXI-RIP FOR INSPECTION AND REPAIR.  LOCOMOTIVE DAMAGE TOGRAB IRONS AND SIDE RAILING AND BRAKE CYLINDERS.  BOTH THE ENGR AND CONDR ON ASSIGNMENT WERE TESTED.HELPER ON ASSIGNMENT WAS BEING TRANSPORTED TO THE EAST END OF THE YARD IN THE CLERICAL VEHICLE ANDWAS NOT DIRECTLY INVOLVED IN THE INCIDENT.  CREW ON TRAIN 654 WAS INTERVIEWED AND THEY DID NOT NOTICE ANYTHING OUT OF ORDINARY WITH THE SWITCH LINE UP WHEN THEY WENT DOWN THE RUNNING TRACK.  CREW MEM

210041-d-10-04-02-TM.Narrative: CONTROL UNIT TFM2341, IDLER FAIX3607, 12 GE LOCOMOTIVES BOUND FOR RUSSIA AND REAR IDLER FAIX3614 WERE SET OUT ON THE FUEL TRACK SPUR AT SERRANO YARD.  ANOTHER ENGINE TFM1320 WAS COUPLED TO TFM2341 BUTTHE MU CABLES WERE NOT CONNECTED.  A NON-RAILROAD CONTRACT EMPLOYEE SET HANDBRAKES ON LEAD ENGINE AND IDLER ENGINE.  HANDBRAKES COULD NOT BE SET ON 12 GE LOCOMOTIVES AS THE STEPS, WALKWAYS AND HANDBRAKES WERE COMPLETELY COVERED WITH A LARGE ONE-PIECE HEAVY DUTY VINYL TARP ON EACH ENGINE.  THE CONTROL UNIT WAS SHUT DOWN BY NON RAILROAD CONTRACT EMPLOYEE FOR FUEL CONSERVATION.  THE ENGINE SHUTDOWNDISCONTINUED AIR CONTINUITY AND THE TRAIN LINE BLED OFF REMAINING AIR.  FOUR HOURS LATER, DUE TO THEGRADE OF THE TRACK .54% AND THE TONNAGE OF THE 16 LOCOMOTIVES, THE HANDBRAKES APPLIED WERE NOT ENOUGH TO HOLD, RESULTING IN THE 16 LOCOMOTIVES TO ROLL TO END OF SPUR TRACK, RAN OVER DERAILER BREAKINGIT AND COLLIDED INTO AN MW TAMPER MACHINE SHOVING IT 140 FEET OFF THE TRACK.  ONE LOCOMOTIVE WAS COMPLETELY OFF THE END OF THE TRACK AND ANOTHER HAD THE LEADING TRUCKS  OFF THE END OF TRACK.NoneNoneNoneNone
